meanings.definition: An outline representing or bounding the shape or form of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully traced the contour of the mountain in her painting.
meanings.sent2: I could see the contour of the tree against the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The contour of the cake looked so perfect that it seemed almost too beautiful to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile created a contour of happiness on her face.
meanings.sent5: The detective followed the contour of the footprints to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: To mold into a specific shape or form.
meanings.sent1: She used her hands to contour the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor carefully contoured the marble to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: He tried to contour the playdough into a perfect circle but ended up with a funny shape instead.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements seemed to contour the music itself.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly contoured the cake into the shape of a flower.

meanings.definition: A line on a map joining points of equal elevation.
meanings.sent1: The hiker followed the contour on the map to reach the mountain peak.
meanings.sent2: The contour on the map showed where the river valley began.
meanings.sent3: The contour on the map looked like a squiggly line drawn by a child.
meanings.sent4: The contour on the map seemed to guide them through the wilderness like a secret path.
meanings.sent5: The contour on the map revealed the hidden beauty of the landscape.
